lead_paragraph: A tour finds traces in Buffalo of the Pan-American Exposition of 1901, featuring dazzling technology, cultural exploitation and the death of President McKinley.

headline.print_headline: Echoes of an Exposition, and an Assassination
headline.main: Echoes of an Exposition, and an Assassination

snippet: A tour finds traces in Buffalo of the Pan-American Exposition of 1901, featuring dazzling technology, cultural exploitation and the death of President McKinley....
abstract: Writer and historian Margaret Creighton points out places and artifacts in Buffalo, NY, related to Pan-American Exposition of 1901; her latest book The Electrifying Fall of Rainbow City: Spectacle and Assassination at the 1901 World’s Fair examines fair's remarkable history as showcase of American ingenuity and setting for assassination of Pres William McKinley.

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: The Electrifying Fall of Rainbow City: Spectacle and Assassination at the 1901 World's Fair (Book)
